violations.issue: Same means (delete customer records) but contradictory ends (comply with right-to-erasure requests vs preserve historical analytics)
violations.suggestion: Reconcile the ends or differentiate the means based on the context or conditions under which they are applied
original_stories: As a Compliance Officer, I want to delete customer records so that we comply with right-to-erasure requests.

violations.issue: Different means (auto-delete after 30 days vs retain for 1 year) for the same end (comply with retention policy) with incompatible outcomes
violations.suggestion: Unify the retention policy or clarify the conditions under which each means is applied
original_stories: As a Compliance Officer, I want to delete customer records so that we preserve historical analytics.
As a Compliance Officer, I want to auto-delete inactive customer records after 30 days so that we comply with our retention policy.

violations.issue: Different means of handling customer records (delete vs soft-delete) that may lead to inconsistent states
violations.suggestion: Define a consistent approach for handling customer records or clarify when each method is appropriate
original_stories: As a Compliance Officer, I want to retain inactive customer records for 1 year so that we comply with our retention policy.

violations.issue: Different roles have means that may conflict (deleting draft records vs preventing deletion of approved records)
violations.suggestion: Ensure that the permissions and means for different roles are compatible and clearly defined
original_stories: As a Compliance Officer, I want to permanently delete records that have been in the recycle bin for 30 days so that we reduce storage costs.
As a Customer Support Agent, I want to delete draft customer records I created so that I can correct onboarding mistakes.

violations.issue: Incompatible means for editing/deleting landmarks (edit any vs delete only own)
violations.suggestion: Clarify the permissions and access control for landmarks to avoid conflicts
original_stories: As a Compliance Officer, I want to prevent agents from deleting approved customer records so that we maintain auditability.
As a User, I’m able to edit any landmark.

expected_stories: As a Compliance Officer, I want to delete customer records so that we comply with right-to-erasure requests.
As a Compliance Officer, I want to delete customer records so that we preserve historical analytics.
As a Compliance Officer, I want to auto-delete inactive customer records after 30 days so that we comply with our retention policy.
As a Compliance Officer, I want to retain inactive customer records for 1 year so that we comply with our retention policy.
As a Compliance Officer, I want to soft-delete customer records to a recycle bin so that they can be restored within 30 days.
As a Compliance Officer, I want to permanently delete records that have been in the recycle bin for 30 days so that we reduce storage costs.
As a Customer Support Agent, I want to delete draft customer records I created so that I can correct onboarding mistakes.
As a Compliance Officer, I want to prevent agents from deleting approved customer records so that we maintain auditability.
As a User, I’m able to edit any landmark.
As a User, I’m able to delete only the landmarks that I added.

story_mapping.2: As a Compliance Officer, I want to delete customer records so that we preserve historical analytics.
story_mapping.3: As a Compliance Officer, I want to auto-delete inactive customer records after 30 days so that we comply with our retention policy.
story_mapping.4: As a Compliance Officer, I want to retain inactive customer records for 1 year so that we comply with our retention policy.

story_mapping.6: As a Compliance Officer, I want to permanently delete records that have been in the recycle bin for 30 days so that we reduce storage costs.
story_mapping.7: As a Customer Support Agent, I want to delete draft customer records I created so that I can correct onboarding mistakes.
story_mapping.8: As a Compliance Officer, I want to prevent agents from deleting approved customer records so that we maintain auditability.
story_mapping.9: As a User, I’m able to edit any landmark.
story_mapping.10: As a User, I’m able to delete only the landmarks that I added.
